comments: Contribution from Klaus Brockhaus, Dec 10 2009: (Start)Interleaving of A010722 and A010692.Also continued fraction expansion of 3+4*sqrt(15)/5.Binomial transform of 6 followed by A122803 without initial terms 1,-2.Inverse binomial transform of A171494. (End)
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,1).
formula: a(n)=-2*(-1)^n+8 =10*(n mod 2)+6*[(n+1) mod 2] - _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 27 2006Contribution from Klaus Brockhaus, Dec 10 2009: (Start)a(n) = a(n-2) for n > 1; a(0) = 6, a(1) = 10.G.f.: 2*(3+5*x)/((1-x)*(1+x)). (End)
mathematica: LinearRecurrence[{0,1},{6,10},90] (* or *) PadRight[{},90,{6,10}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 07 2015 *)
prog: (MAGMA) &cat[ [6, 10]: n in [1..42] ]; [From _Klaus Brockhaus_, Dec 10 2009](PARI) a(n)=6+n%2*4 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 21 2011
crossrefs: Equals 2*A010703. Cf. A010722 (all 6's sequence), A010692 (all 10's sequence), A122803 (powers of -2), A171494. [From _Klaus Brockhaus_, Dec 10 2009]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
